title: Barcelona considering Harry Kane and Marcus Rashford as Luis Suarez replacements
text:
Harry Kane and Marcus Rashford have caught the eye of Barcelona chiefs (Picture: Getty Images)

Barcelona are considering Harry Kane, Marcus Rashford or Kylian Mbappe as potential replacements for Luis Suarez, according to reports in Spain.

The Uruguayan is still a key figure at the Nou Camp, scoring four goals in La Liga already this season, but turns 33 in January and Barca are planning for a future without him.

Mundo Deportivo report that the Spanish champions will assess Suarez’s performances this season and determine whether they need a new striker next summer or in 2021.

Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe is thought to be the first choice to replace Suarez, but England internationals Kane and Rashford are also being considered as transfer targets.

Barca believe that a deal for Mbappe will be possible in 2021 as his current contract with PSG expires in 2022 and they will be open to cashing in on the France forward a year before his deal runs out.

Luis Suarez turns 33-years-old this season (Picture: Getty Images)

However, if a move for the World Cup winner cannot be done, then Kane appears to be the next in line on Barca’s wish list, followed by Rashford and Inter Milan’s Lautaro Martinez.

The Catalan club have reportedly decided against any kind of move for Liverpool’s Roberto Firmino, though, with consensus among the clubs decision makers on the qualities of the other strikers, but not on the Brazilian.

Of the options Barcelona are considering, Kane has enjoyed the most prolific start to the season in front of goal, scoring seven times in 10 games across all competitions.

Mbappe has scored just once in Ligue 1 for PSG, Rashford has netted three times in 10 games for Manchester United in all competitions and Martinez has three in nine.

With Suarez also scoring twice in the Champions League already this campaign, he has only been out-scored by Kane of his potential replacements.
